 Perform a single iteration of the polling loop without field reset.

 Perform collision detection.

Detailed Description

Author:
Oliver Regenfelder

Function Documentation

s16 emvCollisionDetection ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Note:
This function does NOT include the required wait of T_P milliseconds before the first PCD request is send (see [CCP v2.01, PCD 9.3.2.1]). So the caller must assure this wait is performed between the return of emvPoll() and the call to emvCollisionDetection().
Parameters:
[out]piccThe picc struct will be initialized with the uid of the detected card if only one card is present in the field.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: No error, a single card has been found and selected.
EMV_ERR_COLLISION: A collision occured during card singulation.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: No card found, or a timeout occured at some point during the collision detection.
s16 emvPoll ( )

This function polls until the presence of one or more cards is detected or a stop request is received. The polling flags are set according to the detected cards prior to returning.

Note:
This function blocks until at least one card is detected or a stop is requested (emvStopTerminalApplication()).
emvCollisionDetection() must be called after emvPoll() to perform the collision detection for the cards found.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: At least one card is present in the field.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: A stop request has been received.
void emvPollSingleIteration ( )
Note:
This function is needed for some of the EMV L1 certification analog tests and should not be used to implement the polling loop of an EMV compliant terminal.
